name: Burma
startIntroPart1: Considered one of the three greatest kings of Burma, along with Anawrahta and Alaungpaya, Bayinnaung Kyawhtin Nawrahta was king of Toungoo Dynasty of Burma from 1550 to 1581. During his 31-year reign, which has been called 'the greatest explosion of human energy ever seen in Burma', Bayinnaung assembled the largest empire in the history of Southeast Asia, which included much of modern-day Burma, Chinese Shan states, Lan Na, Lan Xang, Manipur and Siam.
declaringWar: You will give me allegience, even if I must force you to do it myself!
attacked: You must be a fool to think my empire will be so easily brought to heel.
defeated: How is Burma now a vassal of such a feeble nation? Why must fate bring the worst upon me?
introduction: You have the honour of meeting the King of Burma, conqurer of the Ten Directions! Do you come bearing tribute for my illustrious Empire?
hateHello: Pyaww nyantar bhar ko lohkyintar lell? (What do you want?)
hateNo: We are not agreeing to that!
afterPeace: I have to say, you resistance was quite impressive indeed
tradeRequest: Such lack of ambition, maybe some of Burma's finest goods will make you see the fruits of war.
uniques: [+1 Production] from [All] tiles [in all cities] <when at war>
[+10]% Production when constructing [{Military} {Land}] units [in all cities] <when at war>
[1] free [Myinsi] units appear <upon entering the [Renaissance era]>

name: Swahili
startIntroPart1: Sultan al-Hasan ibn Suleiman, often referred to as 'Al-Mawahib' ('father of gifts'), was the ruler of the city-state of Kilwa, from 1310 until 1333. Sultan al-Hasan ibn Suleiman is reported to have have been a generous and intelligent man. Numerous construction projects took place during his reign, including the building of the Palace of Husuni Kubwa and a significant extension to the Great Mosque of Kilwa.
declaringWar: Your cities are lacking true beauty only my nation can provide. They shall be rebuilt by our grand fleet!
attacked: You should make your empire look nice insead of destroying ours.
defeated: The Swahilli may now be enslaved, but the beauty of our works shall stand the test of time.
introduction: I welcome you to the magnificent empire of the Swahili. Our cities stand as gems on the oceans edge.
neutralHello: Muda wa biashara? (Are you here to trade?)
hateHello: Una bidhaa gani? (What goods do you have?)
hateNo: We are not agreeing to that!
afterPeace: The Swahili Empire shall stand for another day ... and so shall yours.
tradeRequest: May we interest you in a trade deal?

name: Al Andalus
startIntroPart1: Abd al-Rahman III was an Umayyad prince who reigned as Emir of Cordoba, and later Caliph of Cordoba, from 912 to 961 CE. His reign is remembered as a golden age of Muslim Spain and Umayyad rule, epitomized by his declaration of the second Umayyad Caliphate in 929 CE. He re-established one unified Muslim state in Spain and presided over the expansion of his capital at Cordoba as well as the founding of the impressive caliphal palace at Madinat al-Zahra.
declaringWar: I have crushed infidels, and I have crushed rebels. Now, I shall crush you.
attacked: Our fortressess may be beautifull, but theey are fortressess nontheless. You have underestimated our strength greatly.
defeated: I thought my reign was ordained by God. I thought Andalus shall be blessed with an eternalGolden Age. And now I am humbled by you, and by God.
introduction: I, Caliph Abd al-Rahman III, wlcome to Al-Andalus. Would you like to walk with me in my gardens? We have much to discuss.
hateHello: Here to marvel at our greatness?
hateNo: We are not agreeing to that!
afterPeace: Our forts still stand strong, and the heart of the Andalusian peoples still beats.
tradeRequest: We have an interest in some of your treasures, should we trade?

name: The Sassanid Empire
declaringWar: The earth will tremble with my grand army. It is time for you to deliver my tribute.
attacked: Ha! Have you not read about my titles? I am the king of kings, and you shall kneel to me.
defeated: Just like the Parthians, my empire falls to rubble. Now your nation will make its mark on history forevermore.
introduction: Welcome, I am Shahanshah Sharpur II, the Greatest king of all nations.
hateHello: Why do you ruin my view with your presence?
hateNo: We are not agreeing to that!
afterPeace: The Sassanids will deal with this tribute.
tradeRequest: Can we offer you some of our finest goods?

name: Somalia
declaringWar: Your eyes have strayed away from us for far too long, now is our time to strike!
defeated: Our freedom was temporary after all. We shall be bound as slaves for the rest of eternity then.
introduction: Greetings, We welcome you the nation of wandering bards, Somalia.
hateHello: Why do you show your face to me?
tradeRequest: Please accept this deal, it is the best we can offer
uniques: [100]% of excess happiness converted to [Production] <upon declaring friendship>

name: Pueblo
declaringWar: We shall roam into the wastes you call your nation and destroy your power.
attacked: You disrespect our people and desercrate our works, we will show you justice!
defeated: Why did the spirits abandon us? Our works shall crumble and fall into nothingness, are you pleased?
introduction: The Puebla welcomes you to to my nation. I am Po'pe, leader of the grand deserts
tradeRequest: Accept this deal if this benefits you.

name: The Mughals
declaringWar: Time for you to recive the blessing of being part of our glorious empire!
attacked: Our troops are ready to burn your cities to the ground.
defeated: Our capital has been sacked, our art and culture has been burned to the ground, ... You are now the Emperor of the Mughals.
introduction: Hello, We welcome you to our nation.
hateHello: You are not worth my time.
tradeRequest: This trade will benifit us both
uniques: [+50]% Production when constructing [All] wonders [in all cities] <during a Golden Age>

name: Kush
declaringWar: Weak nations like yours don't benefit true empires like mine. Your people will fair better with me.
attacked: Foolish, out for blood, just like a starving dog.
defeated: The Kush shall live forevermore! We have braved chllenges greater thahan your brutish army, and so, even in death, we shall be free!
introduction: Welcome to my lands. I am King Kashta, leader of the Kush and its streams.
hateNo: We are not agreeing to that!
afterPeace: May you respect these borders forever, or suffer the pain the Kush will bring onto you.
tradeRequest: I will look forwards to your convoys arriving..

name: Phonecia
declaringWar: There is now war in our hands. Look at the sea - it's now full of my ships.
attacked: Are you a fool? Your city districts will understand the destruction of Yam and Moloch.
defeated: One day you may see your capital bathed in flame. ...One day.
introduction: Welcome, come and see the great Phoenician cities. Carry word of it back to your land, and to the rest of the world.
hateHello: Why are you here? You are so poor you cant eevn afford to glance at our works!
hateYes: I'm suprised you have the economy to withhold this deal.
afterPeace: Stick to the mountains, Phoenicia requests the sea.
tradeRequest: Accept these gifts, they are a mere taste of the wealth of Phoenicia.
uniques: [1] Movement point cost to disembark <for [All] units>
Comment [Can relocate their capital after researching Civil Service]
